title: Mia Chloe
author: Mia Chloe
content: Merry Christmas Bitcoin talk.Overtime, the bitcoin discussion section has been flooded with multiple posts on howÂ  users have spent certain amounts of their Bitcoin hodlings on different things. And yes if you are an active contributor of the bitcoin discussion section you must have come across posts of such nature multiple times. Now don't get me wrong.sharing your Bitcoin spendings isn't much of a bad idea however we are in a global celebration period and we should definitely expect more post of such nature to fill the discussion board. So to make things more organized and less clumsy I suggest members make posts and discussions on how they made certain Bitcoin spendings they wish to share here in this thread.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: This thread could have been a good one to reduce the amount of created topic towards what someone did with their holdings and all of that, but I think it won't help at all, just as most members are also aware of the . Announce your rank, merit, or any achievements that make you feel great! , which was created for the same purpose of seeing similar threads everywhere on the reputation board.Â There are only two reasons that will make people continue to create their own topic to celebrate what they have done with their holdings: either to get notice and not for their thread to fall under a page of 10+ and more, or for them to get merit for such spending, and all of those posts are either from merit fishers or those who are just too excited about what they achieved with their bitcoin knowledge.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Mia Chloe on December 25, 2023, 04:58:38 PMSo to make things more organized and less clumsy I suggest members make posts and discussions on how they made certain Bitcoin spendings they wish to share here in this thread.That's simply not gonna work as new members (who are usually creating those kind of merit fishing topics) don't usually check already existing threads before creating new ones. Another factor is that youre thread will eventually drop from page 1, meaning people will most likley not find it. My advice to you is not to waste your time and just lock it.

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: Many people doesn't disclose too well how they spend their bitcoin but the thing is that we have to be conscious of our expenses in cryptocurrency, because I notice that during bitcoin investment many people doesn't like to keep their bitcoin they are hodling and anything can trigger them to make a withdrawal with what they have already saving, so I think that is not good to be inquisitive of spending what we already put on investment because of little problems we have, investment is an investment and it should be strictly called investment.

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: Is Bitcoin spending not supposed to be a secret? If you ask me, that is supposed to be confidential information as it can pose threat to some people base on their locality. This is a public space and you don't know who is reading your post, so your spending should be secret and confidential.

comments.author: Marvelman
comments.body: I've seen people with bitcoin investments that theyre holding onto long-term, but then some little thing happens and they crack and withdraw what they've saved up.Â  To me, that's not good - investment is investment and should be treated as such andÂ  don't chip away at what youve set aside just 'cause life throws you a curveball.Â  I know things happen sometimes that make you desperate for cash but cashing out too early can cost you down the line.Â  It's a balancing act for sure.Â  But the whole point is to leave it alone and let it grow over time.Â  Easier said than done when money's tight, I realize.Â  Still, folks oughta try having some discipline and stick to the long view.Â  Just my two satoshis.

comments.author: rachael9385
comments.body: You did so well to bring up this discussion, but if I may ask, after discussing how, when, on what and why we spend our Bitcoins, will it bring back the Bitcoins we already spent?However, there is no need to talk about this because I really believe that it's a personal something and not public.Sharing with us your Bitcoin journey will be more okay than discussing how we spend our coins because there are no benefits in that. The reasons why I agree with sharing your first Bitcoin experience is because, as a new Bitcoiner, you will need some advice. So, when you share your first Bitcoin experience, others who have been inside the Bitcoin world will give some good advice that might help you grow and accumulate more of your coins without getting scammed by scammers or losing your coins in some fucked exchanges wallets.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: Mia Chloe on December 25, 2023, 04:58:38 PMNow don't get me wrong.sharing your Bitcoin spendings isn't much of a bad idea Except that it actually is much of a bad idea.Bitcoin is pseudoanonymous for a reason, while the public can access the blockchain which contains a record of every already complete transaction, they cannot fix a personality to the different transactions to know who is spending what. To further blur that trail users can utilize coinjoining and mixing options. It is counter productive to publicly discuss what you are spending on with Bitcoin.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: Odohu on December 25, 2023, 06:15:19 PMIs Bitcoin spending not supposed to be a secret? If you ask me, that is supposed to be confidential information as it can pose threat to some people base on their locality. This is a public space and you don't know who is reading your post, so your spending should be secret and confidential.Â  I agree with you and I also believe that it's not a good thing to share your Bitcoin spending with anyone as that's something which is against your own privacy. If you have spent some Bitcoin to purchase physical goods or you have used it to purchase digital goods or maybe something else then you should never share that with anyone else.It not good to share your Bitcoin spending and it's better to have those as the most secret thing you do. I have spent Bitcoin on many good things but I won't share those with anyone. I have bought the things with Bitcoin that I found useful and that's something I would like to keep secret. I must say that I have never used Bitcoin to purchase anything illegal and I will never use it to purchase something illegal but still I don't think it's good to disclose your Bitcoin spending on a public forum like this. And, I suggest everyone to be careful when sharing your Bitcoin spending with others.

comments.author: Latviand
comments.body: Quote from: Odohu on December 25, 2023, 06:15:19 PMIs Bitcoin spending not supposed to be a secret? If you ask me, that is supposed to be confidential information as it can pose threat to some people base on their locality. This is a public space and you don't know who is reading your post, so your spending should be secret and confidential.Â  That's what I'm thinking too, if I recall, there's a public ledger that's recording my purchases so I don't think I'm going to flaunt what I'm spending when that can make someone pinpoint me in that ledger and with the degree of privacy I've already given up being on that public ledger, I think that I deserve to keep that inability for someone to pinpoint me exactly and who I'm dealing with. Only problem with all of this is that I haven't had a lot of transactions lately so it's hard for me to still share.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: I spend my Bitcoin holdings whenever necessary, both in real life and online. Currently, I am building my dream house through my bitcoin and cryptocurrency earnings. So to cover expenses for my housework, I have to sell my bitcoin. It doesn't matter what the price is when I am selling, but I need to cover the cost. I don't feel bad even if the price of Bitcoin rises after I sell it. I believe in Bitcoin for life, not for a lifetime. We are earning money to live a good life, so I have to spend it when necessary.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: Always have been spending some of my holdings not because of the festive season but I do spend them on when needed so it doesn't show any difference whether we are in festive season or not, the key important aspect of it is that do not spend all your holdings maybe as an investor or trader there are some certain amount that should be carved out for spending and holding, whenever that method is applied then you wouldn't over spend you holdings. As trader or investor there is always a need for cushion and or a reserved fund maybe even spare cash to serve you for awhile even at this point of festive season we don't have to alter much of our holdings if we still have the reserved funds because i see no reason for selling our accumulated bitcoin so cheap at expense of festive season some people got them through DCA.

comments.author: Egii Nna
comments.body: Actually, this is a nice idea to share your experience with others on how you spent your bitcoins, but it is also a chance for others to spam, because many will bring different stories, some of which might be true, and from hearing some, you will know that there are friction stories, and when other newbies or members see them, they will think or even believe the story, for instance. I said that for the past year that I have been in bitcoin investment, I have achieved a lot to the extent that I have already bought a house, a luxurious car, and I got married. With the profit I got from my bitcoin investment, we know it can be possible, but it is just a friction story because it hasnâ€™t happened to me yet. Since I see other people writing some nice stories, I might create mine. This is just an example I gave, not my story on how I spent my bitcoin. I will use this medium to encourage you to stop such low-quality posts for just the purpose of fun or discussion. It might discourage others.
